column4: I tried installing kubuntu-destop over ubuntu and during the installation, package configuration asks me about default display manage. How can i set up gutys such that kdm start for kde and gdm for gnome?
that doesn't make any sense
why?
gdm or kdm are started before you login to gnome or kde
it has no idea which one you're going to use
you use one or the other and login to either gnome or kde as you please

then why does it say this  Multiple display managers can run simultaneously if they are configured  to manage different servers; to achieve this, configure the display managers accordingly, edit each of their init scripts in /etc/init.d,  and disable the check for a default display manager.
you want to run multiple X servers?
just pick either gdm or kdm and use only one X server
I need to try KDE4 so what do you think should I do?
using kde4 has nothing to do with your choice between kdm and gdm
pick either gdm or kdm and login to whatever you want through the session menu
and what are the advantages/disadvantages. If it's got nothing to do with it then why are there 2 displaymanagers in the first place?
one comes with gnome the other comes with kde
they both have equivalent funcionality
just pick your favourite
thanks for the info.. I really appreciate your prompt help.
if you are following a guide that tells you to run two X servers, one with kdm and one with gdm, then I'd recommend ignoring that guide as that is totally ridiculous
the guide comes with the default configuration when you try to install kubuntu-desktop
its more of a directive than a guide
installing kubuntu-desktop gives you two X servers?
no it's just a directive. it goes like "you can do this if you chose to and if you need to do this at init.d.."
